title: Claudio Ranieri sacked as Leicester boss: Twitter reacts | Daily Mail Online
text: comments Leicester City sacked manager Claudio Ranieri on Thursday night less than a year after their incredible run to the Premier League title. With the Foxes hovering just one point above the relegation zone, the Italian was relieved of his duties after the team returned home from Wednesday night's 2-1 Champions League defeat to Sevilla. In announcing Ranieri's departure, the club paid tribute to his achievements as the club's 'most successful manager of all time' but said their perilous league position required action. With the news breaking at 7.30pm on Thursday, Sportsmail charts how the world of football reacted to the shock departure and voiced their disapproval less than 24 hours after a creditable defeat in the first leg of the last 16 tie in Andalusia. Gary Lineker was far from pleased with the news that shocked the football fraternity The Leicester fan, who played for the club for seven years, was against the decision Sportsmail columnist Jamie Carragher labelled the decision an 'absolute joke' Former Arsenal midfielder Ray Parlour was also taken by surprise after the news broke Former England cricketer Alec Stewart was mystified at the timing of the sacking Former Arsenal striker Lukas Podolski thanked Ranieri for his service to the Premier League Piers Morgan was outraged by the news and called for Leicester fans to turn on their owners TV funny man James Corden labelled the decision 'crazy' as Twitter reacted to the news Joey Barton 'felt sorry' for Ranieri as he reflected on the decision on his Twitter account Gary Neville joked Antonio Conte could be the next victim of the championship-winning curse RELATED ARTICLES
